name: places/ChIJ-Yix721bwokRw3Rma9IL5HY
adrFormatAddress: 394 Broadway, New York, NY 10013-6023, USA

originalText.text: Huge disappointment. Missed the pickup time by minutes and was refused the order although the restaurant got paid.  TooGoodToGo has not refunded me!  Then another order, I got a very hard, burnt bagel that should be in the garbage, and that's where it went!  TooGoodToGo need to reimburse consumer as this is sounding quite fraudulent. I rather pay full price and get proper food.

originalText.text:
customer service is so slow AND POOR, that I have to wait days for a refund because they can't even take notice of a business being closed or open. Over the weekend I ordered food and the place was closed and there is no way to have the APP take notice of a business being closed. We should have options for auto refunds when a business is closed. No one should have to wait 5-7 days for a refund to be issued back to them. Now, on top of this issue, the reply emails from Zendesk are so unprofessional to ask me again what is the problem. Are these employees at Zendesk even reading the emails and the support ticket? I do not think so.
Especially in New York City, food services are not getting better and people are now taking advantage of the TOOGOODTOGO app but providing little portions of food for a price over $6.99. Someone needs to hire an investigator to test these businesses and to see if they are also following policies and agreements. Toogoodtogo refused to listen to me so, as someone from the PRESS, I started to make videos on some of these businesses cheating customers

originalText.text: Couldn’t pick up an order in-time, due to an emergency. The company refused compensation or any sort of credits, I paid them but got no products… I don’t know what this is called if it isn’t fraud. You are supposed to receive something upon paying, and if you don’t receive anything, technically you are supposed to get the money back — but this business takes advantage of customer’s like this. I hope they get investigated by authorities.

You are supposed to receive something upon paying, and if you don’t receive anything, technically you are supposed to get the money back — but this business takes advantage of customer’s like this. I hope they get investigated by authorities.

originalText.text: First order was great, the second and third were very disappointing. Arrived right at the pickup time and both restaurants were closed. No notification. No attempt to prevent me from having to travel to the restaurant only to find the doors locked, and no employees anywhere to be found. Both times there were other clients left empty handed. Contacted (via app) the company but still haven’t been refunded. Again, great first experience and actually liked the chance to discover a new place that I now frequently visit. I like the mission of the business, but traveling across town to rescue food at the time given to me by the restaurant only to find a place closed with no attempt to notify me is really inexcusable. No refund yet, kinda the most sour part of this whole experience.

originalText.text: Good concept yet sadly this business cares more about the restaurants than their consumers. They take days for an agent to reach you via email. They don’t offer ANY compensation when there’s an issue that wouldd normally warrant a refund or credit like other businesses! If you dispute the charge for non delivery of service, they block your account!!!
